problem_text:
21.68. A finite group G is said to be semi-abelian if it has a sequence of subgroups 1 = G0 ⩽ G1 ⩽ · · · ⩽ Gn = G such that for every i the subgroup Gi+1 is isomorphic to a quotient of a semidirect product Ai ⋊ Gi for some abelian group Ai.
Conjecture: Semi-abelian finite groups are monomial.
M. Kida
